parameters.name: Objects
parameters.description: Array of selectable objects: can be the same type of objects (e.g., an array of faces or an array of edges) or different types of objects (e.g., an array of entities of faces and edges ) if an object is not selected, then it is ignored

parameters.name: AppendFlag
parameters.description: True to append the objects to the selection list, false to replace the current selection list with these objects

title: IModelDocExtension.MultiSelect
signature:
System.Int32 MultiSelect( 
   System.Object
Objects
,
   System.Boolean
AppendFlag
,
   System.Object
Data
)

parameters.name: Objects
parameters.description: Array of selectable objects: can be the same type of objects (e.g., an array of faces or an array of edges) or different types of objects (e.g., an array of entities of faces and edges ) if an object is not selected, then it is ignored

parameters.name: AppendFlag
parameters.description: True to append the objects to the selection list, false to replace the current selection list with these objects

returns: Number of objects selected in the model
remarks:
If this now obsolete method is used to populate a selection box in a PropertyManager page, then
IPropertyManagerPage2Handler9::OnSubmitSelection
only fires when set to true and
ISelectData::Mark
is set to 0.
Use
IModelDocExtension::MultiSelect2
if you need IPropertyManagerPage2Handler9::OnSubmitSelection to fire when set to true and ISelectData::Mark is set to either a 0 or non-0 value.
The
Callout
property of the
ISelectData
object is not used by this method.
